Department.title: Department
Department.description: Represents a department within the educational institution.

Class.title: Class
Class.description: Represents a class within a department.

departmentId.description: Reference to the Department. (Relationship: Department 1:N Class)

name.description: Name of the class (e.g., II-A, III-B).

departmentId.description: Reference to the Department. (Relationship: Department 1:N Student)

classId.description: Reference to the Class. (Relationship: Class 1:N Student)

admissionType.description: The admission quota for the student.

mentor.description: The name of the assigned mentor.

id.description: Unique identifier for the staff member.

email.description: Email address of the staff member.

LateRecord.title: LateRecord
LateRecord.description: Represents a record of a student being late.

id.description: Unique identifier for the late record.

studentId.description: Reference to the Student. (Relationship: Student 1:N LateRecord)

staffId.description: Reference to the Staff member who marked the student late. (Relationship: Staff 1:N LateRecord)

FeeItem.title: Fee Item
FeeItem.description: Represents a single category of a fee, like tuition or exam fees.

total.description: Total amount for this fee category.

paid.description: Amount paid for this fee category.

balance.description: Remaining balance for this fee category.

Fee.title: Fee
Fee.description: Represents a comprehensive fee profile for a single student.

classId.description: Denormalized reference to the Class for rules.

concession.description: Concession amount to be deducted from the total fee.

totalAmount.description: Calculated total of all fee categories.

totalPaid.description: Calculated total paid across all categories.

totalBalance.description: Calculated total balance across all categories.

recordedBy.description: ID of the staff who last updated the fee.

FeeTransaction.title: FeeTransaction
FeeTransaction.description: Represents a single payment transaction against a specific fee category.

feeType.description: The category of fee this payment applies to.

amount.description: The amount paid in this transaction.

recordedBy.description: ID of the staff who recorded the payment.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to be secure, scalable, and easily debuggable, adhering to the core principles of Authorization Independence, Clarity of Intent, DBAC (Database-Based Access Control), and QAPs (Rules are not Filters). It avoids hierarchical authorization dependencies (`get()`) by denormalizing authorization context and uses structural segregation to ensure homogeneous security postures.

**Authorization Independence (Denormalization):**
The structure denormalizes authorization data to avoid `get()` calls in security rules.  The `Class` document contains admin and teacher role, which are duplicated to the `Student` and `LateRecord` documents. This ensures that when a student's late record is being created, the security rules can validate authorization without needing to read the parent `Class` document. This approach maintains atomicity for write operations.

**Structural Segregation:**
Each collection houses documents with similar access control needs. For example, `departments`, `classes`, `students`, `staff`, and `lateRecords` are stored in separate collections, each with specific rules.

**Access Modeling:**
*   **Ownership:** The `/users/{userId}/...` pattern is used to manage user-specific data, ensuring that only the user can access their data.
*   **Collaborative Data (Membership Map):** The `Class` document utilizes the `admins` and `teachers` fields, which functions as a membership map. Admins and teachers have access to create, update, and read data related to the class.
*   **Global Roles (DBAC):**  Global roles are managed using dedicated collections, such as `/roles_admin/{uid}`. The existence of a document in this collection grants the user admin privileges.

**QAPs (Rules are not Filters):**
The structure is designed to support secure `list` operations by avoiding the need to filter data based on access in the rules.  Access is granted based on the user's role and the denormalized authorization data in the documents.

In summary, the data structure promotes secure, scalable, and maintainable data management by explicitly defining authorization contexts, segregating data based on access requirements, and denormalizing relevant authorization data to avoid complex rule evaluations.
